intro: Licania minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered licania, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and typically clustered in inflorescences, producing a modest display of white or pale yellow blooms. Licania minutiflora is adapted to moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid, tropical climates.
